page.title: 01Landmoth and Beacon Hills
page.content: The area lies to th east of Northallerton. The focal point of the area is a ridge of high ground with a North/South axis giving uninterruped views towards the Vale of York and Pennines to the west and the rugged North Yorkshire Moors to the East. Close to the areas highest point Landmoth Hill(165m), at Bonfire Hill, in July 1981 to celebrate the Royal Wedding of Prince Charles and Lady Diana Spencer, a bonfire beacon was set alight as part of a country wide chain. It is a rural area with agriculture its main base. Though the area runs a main road rout A19(T) which links the north of the county to the South. The photographs show the area as it was in the September of 1985.
